abstract: Despite doubts about an alleged Iranian plot, an adviser to the Saudi government seemed to up the ante by claiming that one of the accused plotters was also involved in a conspiracy to incite protests in Bahrain earlier this year.
snippet: Despite doubts about an alleged Iranian plot, an adviser to the Saudi government seemed to up the ante by claiming that one of the accused plotters was also involved in a conspiracy to incite protests in Bahrain earlier this year.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Updated | Friday | 11:37 a.m. While a number of prominent experts on Iran are not convinced that the Iranian government really did authorize a plot to assassinate Saudi Arabia's ambassador in Washington -- with the help of a Mexican drug cartel and a used-car salesman -- one well-connected Saudi commentator insists that the scheme was real, and part of a much broader conspiracy against his nation.

headline.main: Saudi Claims Alleged Iranian Plotter Also Orchestrated Bahrain Unrest
